snippet: The release of the report was deferred after intense lobbying by the country’s newly elected government, which is said to be prepared to cooperate with the investigation.
abstract: United Nations agrees to defer release of landmark report on potential war crimes in Sri Lanka during long war with rebel Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam; decision follows intense lobbying by Sri Lankan officials in what top officials describe as a broad new level of cooperation; nation will now demonstrate whether it can mount its own credible investigation into atrocities.
lead_paragraph: The release of the report was deferred after intense lobbying by the country’s newly elected government, which is said to be prepared to cooperate with the investigation.

headline.main: U.N. Delays Release of Report on Possible War Crimes in Sri Lanka
headline.print_headline: U.N. Grants Sri Lanka Deferral in Inquiry

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
